result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley N Weinke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bradley N Weinke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bradley N Weinke was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bradley N Weinke was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Bradley N Weinke in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant, Bradley N Weinke, appeared by jail video with Atty. Adam Raabe of the State Public Defender office. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $500 cash bond with felony conds., no contact with J.T., residence, workplace, except telephone contact only for the placement of their child, may return residence with officer one time to get personal belongings, and submit DNA sample before jail release. Time limits not waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
